lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Chandler.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Chandler.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Chandler is a task manager that allows users to add, delete, and view tasks.
* A Chandler object represents the task manager.
* @param filePath The file path to the file from which to load the task list
* ChandlerException is a custom exception class that extends the Exception class.
* Constructs a new ChandlerException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The message explaining the exception.
* Deadline class represents a task with a deadline
* A Deadline object represents a task with a deadline
* Constructs a new Deadline object with the given description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the deadline
* @param by The deadline of the task
* Returns the task type of the deadline
* Overrides the toString method in Task
* Indicates the deadline of the task
* An Event object represents an event task with a description, start time and end time
* Constructs a new Event object with the given description, start and end time.
* @param description The description of the event
* @param from The start time of the event
* @param to The end time of the event
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns the task type of the event
* Overrides the toString method in Task
* The Parser class is responsible for parsing the input from the user and calling the appropriate methods in TaskList.
* Parses the input and calls the appropriate method in TaskList
* @param input The input from the user
* @throws ChandlerException If the input is invalid
public void parseInput(String input, TaskList taskList) throws ChandlerException {
throw new ChandlerException("You need to specify a task.");
throw new ChandlerException("You need to specify if it's a todo, deadline, or event.");
* Parses the words in the input line from the file and creates a task from it
* @param line The line from the file
* @throws ChandlerException If the line is corrupted
public void parseLineFromFile(String line, TaskList taskList) throws ChandlerException {
String[] parts = line.split(" \\| "); // Assuming the format is: Type | Status | Description | Additional Info (optional)
throw new ChandlerException("Corrupted data: Unexpected format in the file.");
* Deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file
* A Storage object represents the storage of the programme
* Load the task list from the file
* @param filePath The file path to the file from which to load the task list
* @throws ChandlerException If the file is not found or there is an error reading the file
public void loadTaskListFromFile(TaskList taskList, String filePath) throws ChandlerException {
throw new ChandlerException("File not found: " + e.getMessage());
throw new ChandlerException("Error reading file: " + e.getMessage());
* Parses the words in the input line from the file and add a task to the task list
* @param taskType The type of the task - todo, deadline, or event
* @param doneStatus The status of the task - done or not done
* @param description The description of the task
* @param additionalInfo The additional information of the task such as deadline or event time
* @param taskList The task list to which the created task will be added.
* @throws ChandlerException If there is a problem creating the task due to corrupted data or unexpected task type.
public void createTaskFromParsedLine(String taskType, int doneStatus,
String description, String additionalInfo, TaskList taskList) throws ChandlerException {
Event taskEvent = new Event(description, fromTo[0], fromTo[1]);
throw new ChandlerException("Corrupted data: Unexpected task type in the file.");
* Save the task list to the file
* Format: Type | Status | Description | Additional Info (optional)
* @throws ChandlerException If there is an error writing to the file
public void saveTaskListToFile(TaskList taskList) throws ChandlerException {
throw new ChandlerException(" Corrupted data: Unexpected task type in the file.");
throw new ChandlerException("Error writing to file: " + e.getMessage());
* Represents a task in the task list.
* A Task object represents a task with a description and a status.
* Constructs a new Task object with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task
* Returns the status icon of the task - X or empty string
* @return The status icon of the task as a String
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns the task type of the task
* @return The task type of the task as a String

* @return The description of the task as a String
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task, indicating its status and description.
* @return A string representation of the task.
* A TaskList object represents the task list that contains the tasks
* Add a task to the list
* @param task The task to be added
* Get the size of the list

* @param index The index of the task in the list

System.out.println("Here are the commands you can use:");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "mark <task number> - Mark a task as done");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "unmark <task number> - Mark a task as not done");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "find <keyword> - Find tasks with the keyword");
* Add a todo to the taskList
* @param description The description of the todo
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "Awesome! Something to do without deadline hehe\n"
+ OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "You better not procrastinate... or maybe you should");
* Add a deadline to the taskList
* @param description The description of the deadline
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "Oh wow... a deadline, how exciting :)\n"
+ OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "A deadline a day keeps the sanity away.");
* Add an event to the taskList
* @param description The description of the event
Event taskEvent = new Event(task, from, to);
+ OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "Can it BE any more fun?");
* Delete a task from the list
* @param task_number The index of the task to be deleted
* @throws ChandlerException If the task number is invalid
public void deleteTask(int task_number) throws ChandlerException {
throw new ChandlerException("Task number exceeds the list size");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "YES, less things to do! I've removed this task:");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "Now you have " + (listSize) + " tasks in the list.");
* @param task_number The index of the task to be marked as done
* @throws ChandlerException If the task number is invalid
public void markTaskAsDone(int task_number) throws ChandlerException {
throw new ChandlerException("Task number exceeds the list size");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "But, you have already done the task.");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "I can totally see why you would mark it again.");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Mark a task as not done
* @param task_number The index of the task to be marked as not done
* @throws ChandlerException If the task number is invalid
public void markTaskAsUndone(int task_number) throws ChandlerException {
throw new ChandlerException("Task number exceeds list size");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "You must be enjoying the task so much :)");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "Because you are unmarking an unmarked task.");
System.out.println(OUTPUT_INDENTATION + "Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Find tasks with the input keyword
* @param keyword The keyword to be searched among the tasks in the list
System.out.println("I'm hopeless and awkward and desperate for love!");
System.out.println("I mean... here are the matching tasks in your list.");
System.out.println("Oops, there is no task that contains the keyword: " + keyword);
System.out.println("You have " + matchingTasks + " matching tasks in the list.");
* List all the tasks in the list
System.out.println("You currently do not have any tasks.");
System.out.println("Let's keep it that way shall we? :)");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Todo class represents a todo task
* A Todo object represents a todo task with a description
* Constructs a new Todo object with the given description.
* @param description The description of the todo
* Returns the task type of the todo

* A Ui object represents the user interface of the program
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Chandler. Your personal sarcastic task manager.");
System.out.println("I'm here to help you manage your tasks. :)");
System.out.println("To view the list of commands, you can type 'help'.");
